com.flurry.android.ads

Class FlurryAdNative

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.flurry.android.ads.FlurryAdNative

  • public final class FlurryAdNative
extends Object
    Native ad object. Used to display Native ads.
    Author:
    2009-2015 Flurry, Inc. All Rights Reserved
    See Also:
    Flurry Publisher Support Site

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      FlurryAdNative(Context context, String adSpace)
      Create an instance of FlurryAdNative.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FlurryAdNative

        public FlurryAdNative(Context context,
              String adSpace)
        Create an instance of FlurryAdNative.
        Parameters:
        context - The current activity context.
        adSpace - The placement of the ad within your app. For example, for a splash screen ad, it might be named "SPLASH_SCREEN"

    • Method Detail

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Destroys the ad object and releases all associated resources.

      • setListener

        public void setListener(FlurryAdNativeListener listener)
        Set the lister for asynchronous ad serving. The listener is an interface which can be implemented to receive notification of various events associated with this ad.
        Parameters:
        listener - Your implementation of the ad listener.

      • setTargeting

        public void setTargeting(FlurryAdTargeting targeting)
        Set the targeting for this ad. Targeting allows partners to supply information they track internally, which is not available to Flurry's targeting system. If the targeting settings are matched on the ad server, a subset of targeted ads will be delivered to the user.
        Parameters:
        targeting - The ad targeting.

      • setSupportedStyles

        public void setSupportedStyles(List<Integer> supportedStyles)
        Set the style(s) of native ads that the application supports. Right now only one style is supported (Gemini).
        Parameters:
        supportedStyles - The supported styles.

      • fetchAd

        public void fetchAd()
        Fetches and prepares an ad for display. This method should be used in conjunction with the ad listener.

      • isReady

        public boolean isReady()
        Indicates whether or not the ad is ready for display.
        Returns:
        true if the ad is ready for display, false if not.

      • isExpired

        public boolean isExpired()
        Indicates whether or not the ad is expired. Expired ads should not be shown to the user and should be removed from the display.
        Returns:
        true if the ad is expired, false if not.

      • setTrackingView

        public void setTrackingView(View trackingView)
        Set the tracking view for the ad. Impressions and clicks are tracked using this view, so it is extremely important to set this.
        Parameters:
        trackingView - The tracking view for the ad.

      • setExpandableTrackingView

        public void setExpandableTrackingView(View trackingView,
                             View linkView)
        Set the expandable tracking view for the ad. Impressions and clicks are tracked using this view, so it is extremely important to set this.
        Parameters:
        trackingView - The tracking view for the ad.
        linkView - The click view for taking to the linked ad.

      • setCollapsableTrackingView

        public void setCollapsableTrackingView(View trackingView,
                              View collapseView)
        Set the collapsable tracking view for the ad. Impressions and clicks are tracked using this view, so it is extremely important to set this.
        Parameters:
        trackingView - The tracking view for the ad.
        collapseView - The click view for collapsing the unit.

      • removeTrackingView

        public void removeTrackingView()
        Remove the tracking view for the ad. This is particularly important if views are recycled/reused. Your adapter should always remove the tracking view before setting up a new view.

      • getStyle

        public int getStyle()
        Returns the style of the ad, corresponding to the styles listed in #FlurryAdNativeStyle. This is used to build your view - different styles may have different layouts. Only one style (Gemini) is supported at the moment.
        Returns:
        The style of the ad.

      • getAsset

        public FlurryAdNativeAsset getAsset(String assetName)
        Retrieves an ad asset given the asset name. The ad assets are used to construct the view. The ad must be fetched/ready to retrieve assets.
        Returns:
        The asset, or null if not found.

      • getAssetList

        public List<FlurryAdNativeAsset> getAssetList()
        Retrieves the list of ad assets for the ad. The ad assets are used to construct the view. The ad must be fetched/ready to retrieve assets.
        Returns:
        The list of ad assets.

      • isVideoAd

        public boolean isVideoAd()
        Identify if this is a video ad, accordingly prepare your ad view.
        Returns:
        true if Video otherwise returns false

      • getAdSpace

        public String getAdSpace()
        get the adspace of the ad object
        Returns:
        adspace
